de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class WizardDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v4.app.Fragment
      • android.support.v4.app.DialogFragment
        • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
          • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractHeaderDialogFragment
            • de.mrapp.android.dialog.WizardDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.arch.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.DialogInterface, android.content.DialogInterface.OnCancelListener, android.content.DialogInterface.OnDismissListener, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, Dialog, HeaderDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, WizardDialogDecorator

    public class WizardDialog
extends AbstractHeaderDialogFragment
implements WizardDialogDecorator
    A dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provides a navigation for switching between multiple fragments. For creating or showing such dialogs, the methods WizardDialog#create() or WizardDialog#show() of the builder WizardDialog.Builder can be used.
    Since:
    3.0.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  WizardDialog.Builder
      A builder, which allows to create and show dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and provide a navigation for switching between multiple fragments.
      static class  WizardDialog.TabPosition
      Contains all possible positions of the dialog's tabs.
      static interface  WizardDialog.WizardListener
      Defines the interface a class, which should be notified when the user navigates within a WizardDialog, by using its next-, back- and finish-button.

      • setScrollableArea

        public final void setScrollableArea(ScrollableArea.Area top,
                                    ScrollableArea.Area bottom)
        Description copied from interface: MaterialDialogDecorator
        Sets the areas of the dialog, which should be scrollable.
        Specified by:
        setScrollableArea in interface MaterialDialogDecorator
        Overrides:
        setScrollableArea in class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        Parameters:
        top - The top-most area, which should be scrollable, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area or null, if no area should be scrollable
        bottom - The bottom-most area, which should be scrollable, as a value of the enum ScrollableArea.Area. If the top-most area is null, the bottom-most are must be null as well. The index of the bottom-most area must be at least the index of the top-most area

        public final void enableTabLayout(boolean enable)
        Description copied from interface: WizardDialogDecorator

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • addWizardListener

        public final void addWizardListener(@NonNull
                                    WizardDialog.WizardListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: WizardDialogDecorator
        Adds a new listener, which should be notified, when the user navigates within the dialog. Note, that the attached listeners are not stored using a dialog's onSaveInstanceState-method, because it is not serializable. Therefore this method must be called again after configuration changes, e.g when the orientation of the device has changed, in order to re-register the listeners.
        Specified by:
        addWizardListener in interface WizardDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be added, as an instance of the type WizardDialog.WizardListener. The listener may not be null

      • removeWizardListener

        public final void removeWizardListener(@NonNull
                                       WizardDialog.WizardListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: WizardDialogDecorator
        Removes a specific listener, which should not be notified, when the user navigates within the dialog.
        Specified by:
        removeWizardListener in interface WizardDialogDecorator
        Parameters:
        listener - The listener, which should be removed, as an instance of the type WizardDialog.WizardListener. The listener may not be null

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • onSaveInstanceState

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        protected final void onRestoreInstanceState(@NonNull
                                            android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Description copied from class: AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog is re-created in order to restore its state. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to restore the properties, which are stored in the onSaveInstanceState-method.
        Overrides:
        onRestoreInstanceState in class AbstractHeaderDialogFragment
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, which has been used to store the state, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
